item.title: dplyr Cheatsheet to DataFrames.jl Page 1
item.description: Introduction With the release of v1.0 of the DataFrames.jl package, it would seem appropriate to introduce a rather comprehensive cheatsheet of it. One that is of special use to people who come from tidyverse (arguably, the best data transformation syntax there is for combined expressiveness and brevity). The order of topics is the same as dplyr cheatsheet. using RDatasets, RCall, DataFrames, StatsBase, InteractiveErrors R"library(dplyr)"; Setting up the data using RCall data = dataset("datasets", "iris") @rput data; Summarize Cases summarize julia> R"summarize(data, avSL = mean(SepalLength), avSW = mean(SepalWidth))" RObject{VecSxp} avSL avSW 1 5.
